Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־יוֹנָ֥ה בֶן־אֲמִתַּ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jonah son of Amittai:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yvonah ven-amitay lemor

Hebrew: ק֠וּם לֵ֧ךְ אֶל־נִֽינְוֵ֛ה הָעִ֥יר הַגְּדוֹלָ֖ה וּקְרָ֣א עָלֶ֑יהָ כִּֽי־עָלְתָ֥ה רָעָתָ֖ם לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: Go at once to Nineveh, that great city, and proclaim judgment upon it; for their wickedness has come before Me.
Transliteration: kum lekhe el-niyneveh haiyr hagedvolah ukera aleyha khiy-aletah raatam lefanay

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם יוֹנָה֙ לִבְרֹ֣חַ תַּרְשִׁ֔ישָׁה מִלִּפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֨רֶד יָפ֜וֹ וַיִּמְצָ֥א אֳנִיָּ֣ה ׀ בָּאָ֣ה תַרְשִׁ֗ישׁ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן שְׂכָרָ֜הּ וַיֵּ֤רֶד בָּהּ֙ לָב֤וֹא עִמָּהֶם֙ תַּרְשִׁ֔ישָׁה מִלִּפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jonah, however, started out to flee to Tarshish from G<small>OD</small>’s service. He went down to Joppa and found a ship going to Tarshish. He paid the fare and went aboard to sail with the others to Tarshish, away from G<small>OD</small>’s service.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yvonah liverocha tareshiyshah milifeney yehovah vayered yafvo vayimetsa oniyah vaah tareshiysh vayiten shekharah vayered vah lavvo imahem tareshiyshah milifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה הֵטִ֤יל רֽוּחַ־גְּדוֹלָה֙ אֶל־הַיָּ֔ם וַיְהִ֥י סַֽעַר־גָּד֖וֹל בַּיָּ֑ם וְהָ֣אֳנִיָּ֔ה חִשְּׁבָ֖ה לְהִשָּׁבֵֽר׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> cast a mighty wind upon the sea, and such a great tempest came upon the sea that the ship was in danger of breaking up.
Transliteration: vayhovah hetiyl rucha-gedvolah el-hayam vayehiy saar-gadvol vayam vehaoniyah chishevah lehishaver

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ הַמַּלָּחִ֗ים וַֽיִּזְעֲקוּ֮ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אֱלֹהָיו֒ וַיָּטִ֨לוּ אֶת־הַכֵּלִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּֽאֳנִיָּה֙ אֶל־הַיָּ֔ם לְהָקֵ֖ל מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְיוֹנָ֗ה יָרַד֙ אֶל־יַרְכְּתֵ֣י הַסְּפִינָ֔ה וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב וַיֵּרָדַֽם׃
Translated: In their fright, the sailors cried out, each to his own god; and they flung the ship’s cargo overboard to make it lighter for them. Jonah, meanwhile, had gone down into the hold of the vessel where he lay down and fell asleep.
Transliteration: vayiyreu hamalachiym vayizeaku iysh el-elohayv vayatilu et-hakheliym asher vaoniyah el-hayam lehakel mealeyhem veyvonah yarad el-yarekhetey hasefiynah vayishekhav vayeradam

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֤ב אֵלָיו֙ רַ֣ב הַחֹבֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ מַה־לְּךָ֣ נִרְדָּ֑ם ק֚וּם קְרָ֣א אֶל־אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אוּלַ֞י יִתְעַשֵּׁ֧ת הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים לָ֖נוּ וְלֹ֥א נֹאבֵֽד׃
Translated: The captain went over to him and cried out, “How can you be sleeping so soundly! Up, call upon your god! Perhaps the god will be kind to us and we will not perish.”
Transliteration: vayikerav elayv rav hachovel vayomer lvo mah-lekha niredam kum kera el-eloheykha ulay yiteashet haElohim lanu velo noved

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ לְכוּ֙ וְנַפִּ֣ילָה גֽוֹרָל֔וֹת וְנֵ֣דְעָ֔ה בְּשֶׁלְּמִ֛י הָרָעָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָ֑נוּ וַיַּפִּ֙לוּ֙ גּֽוֹרָל֔וֹת וַיִּפֹּ֥ל הַגּוֹרָ֖ל עַל־יוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: Those aboard said to one another, “Let us cast lots and find out on whose account this misfortune has come upon us.” They cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah.
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-reehu lekhu venafiylah gvoralvot venedeah veshelemiy haraah hazot lanu vayafilu gvoralvot vayifol hagvoral al-yvonah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו הַגִּידָה־נָּ֣א לָ֔נוּ בַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר לְמִי־הָרָעָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָ֑נוּ מַה־מְּלַאכְתְּךָ֙ וּמֵאַ֣יִן תָּב֔וֹא מָ֣ה אַרְצֶ֔ךָ וְאֵֽי־מִזֶּ֥ה עַ֖ם אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: They said to him, “Tell us, you who have brought this misfortune upon us, what is your business? Where have you come from? What is your country, and of what people are you?”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv hagiydah-na lanu vaasher lemiy-haraah hazot lanu mah-melakhetekha umeayiin tavvo mah aretsekha veey-mizeh am atah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם עִבְרִ֣י אָנֹ֑כִי וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ אֲנִ֣י יָרֵ֔א אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם וְאֶת־הַיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃
Translated: “I am a Hebrew,” he replied. “I worship the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Heaven, who made both sea and land.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem iveriy anokhiy veet-yehovah elohey hashamayiim aniy yare asher-ashah et-hayam veet-hayavashah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ יִרְאָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֑יתָ כִּֽי־יָדְע֣וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים כִּֽי־מִלִּפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא בֹרֵ֔חַ כִּ֥י הִגִּ֖יד לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: The men were greatly terrified, and they asked him, “What have you done?” And when the men learned that he was fleeing from G<small>OD</small>’s service—for so he told them—
Transliteration: vayiyreu haanashiym yireah gedvolah vayomeru elayv mah-zot ashiyta khiy-yadeu haanashiym khiy-milifeney yehovah hu vorecha khiy higiyd lahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ מַה־נַּ֣עֲשֶׂה לָּ֔ךְ וְיִשְׁתֹּ֥ק הַיָּ֖ם מֵֽעָלֵ֑ינוּ כִּ֥י הַיָּ֖ם הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וְסֹעֵֽר׃
Translated: they said to him, “What must we do to you to make the sea calm around us?” For the sea was growing more and more stormy.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv mah-naasheh lakhe veyishetok hayam mealeynu khiy hayam hvolekhe vesoer

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם שָׂא֙וּנִי֙ וַהֲטִילֻ֣נִי אֶל־הַיָּ֔ם וְיִשְׁתֹּ֥ק הַיָּ֖ם מֵֽעֲלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י יוֹדֵ֣עַ אָ֔נִי כִּ֣י בְשֶׁלִּ֔י הַסַּ֧עַר הַגָּד֛וֹל הַזֶּ֖ה עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: He answered, “Heave me overboard, and the sea will calm down for you; for I know that this terrible storm came upon you on my account.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem shauniy vahatiyluniy el-hayam veyishetok hayam mealeykhem khiy yvodea aniy khiy vesheliy hasaar hagadvol hazeh aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיַּחְתְּר֣וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים לְהָשִׁ֛יב אֶל־הַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה וְלֹ֣א יָכֹ֑לוּ כִּ֣י הַיָּ֔ם הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וְסֹעֵ֖ר עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Nevertheless, the men rowed hard to regain the shore, but they could not, for the sea was growing more and more stormy about them.
Transliteration: vayacheteru haanashiym lehashiyv el-hayavashah velo yakholu khiy hayam hvolekhe vesoer aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֨וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֜ה וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אָנָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אַל־נָ֣א נֹאבְדָ֗ה בְּנֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַל־תִּתֵּ֥ן עָלֵ֖ינוּ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֑יא כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר חָפַ֖צְתָּ עָשִֽׂיתָ׃
Translated: Then they cried out to G<small>OD</small>: “Oh, please, E<small>TERNAL</small> One, do not let us perish on account of this man’s life. Do not hold us guilty of killing an innocent person! For You, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, by Your will, have brought this about.”
Transliteration: vayikereu el-yehovah vayomeru anah yehovah al-na novedah venefesh haiysh hazeh veal-titen aleynu dam nakiy khiy-atah yehovah khaasher chafatseta ashiyta

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־יוֹנָ֔ה וַיְטִלֻ֖הוּ אֶל־הַיָּ֑ם וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד הַיָּ֖ם מִזַּעְפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And they heaved Jonah overboard, and the sea stopped raging.
Transliteration: vayisheu et-yvonah vayetiluhu el-hayam vayaamod hayam mizaefvo

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֧וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים יִרְאָ֥ה גְדוֹלָ֖ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּֽזְבְּחוּ־זֶ֙בַח֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיִּדְּר֖וּ נְדָרִֽים׃
Translated: The men feared G<small>OD</small> greatly; they offered a sacrifice to G<small>OD</small> and they made vows.
Transliteration: vayiyreu haanashiym yireah gedvolah et-yehovah vayizevechu-zevach layhovah vayideru nedariym

Hebrew: וַיְמַ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ דָּ֣ג גָּד֔וֹל לִבְלֹ֖עַ אֶת־יוֹנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י יוֹנָה֙ בִּמְעֵ֣י הַדָּ֔ג שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יָמִ֖ים וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה לֵילֽוֹת׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah; and Jonah remained in the fish’s belly three days and three nights.
Transliteration: vayeman yehovah dag gadvol liveloa et-yvonah vayehiy yvonah vimeey hadag sheloshah yamiym usheloshah leylvot

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֣ל יוֹנָ֔ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו מִמְּעֵ֖י הַדָּגָֽה׃
Translated: Jonah prayed to the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God from the belly of the fish.
Transliteration: vayitefalel yvonah el-yehovah elohayv mimeey hadagah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר קָ֠רָ֠אתִי מִצָּ֥רָה לִ֛י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑נִי מִבֶּ֧טֶן שְׁא֛וֹל שִׁוַּ֖עְתִּי שָׁמַ֥עְתָּ קוֹלִֽי׃
Translated:
He said:
In my trouble I called to GOD,
Who answered me;
From the belly of Sheol I cried out,
And You heard my voice.
Transliteration: vayomer karatiy mitsarah liy el-yehovah vayaaneniy miveten shevol shivaetiy shamaeta kvoliy

Hebrew: וַתַּשְׁלִיכֵ֤נִי מְצוּלָה֙ בִּלְבַ֣ב יַמִּ֔ים וְנָהָ֖ר יְסֹבְבֵ֑נִי כׇּל־מִשְׁבָּרֶ֥יךָ וְגַלֶּ֖יךָ עָלַ֥י עָבָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
You cast me into the depths,
Into the heart of the sea,
The floods engulfed me;
All Your breakers and billows
Swept over me.
Transliteration: vatasheliykheniy metsulah vilevav yamiym venahar yesoveveniy khׇl-mishevareykha vegaleykha alay avaru

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי נִגְרַ֖שְׁתִּי מִנֶּ֣גֶד עֵינֶ֑יךָ אַ֚ךְ אוֹסִ֣יף לְהַבִּ֔יט אֶל־הֵיכַ֖ל קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
I thought I was driven away
Out of Your sight:
Would I ever gaze again
Upon Your holy temple?
Transliteration: vaaniy amaretiy nigerashetiy mineged eyneykha akhe vosiyf lehaviyt el-heykhal kׇdeshekha

Hebrew: אֲפָפ֤וּנִי מַ֙יִם֙ עַד־נֶ֔פֶשׁ תְּה֖וֹם יְסֹבְבֵ֑נִי ס֖וּף חָב֥וּשׁ לְרֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
The waters closed in over me,
The deep engulfed me.
Weeds twined around my head.
Transliteration: afafuniy mayiim ad-nefesh tehvom yesoveveniy suf chavush leroshiy

Hebrew: לְקִצְבֵ֤י הָרִים֙ יָרַ֔דְתִּי הָאָ֛רֶץ בְּרִחֶ֥יהָ בַעֲדִ֖י לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַתַּ֧עַל מִשַּׁ֛חַת חַיַּ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
I sank to the base of the mountains;
The bars of the earth closed upon me forever.
Yet You brought my life up from the pit,
My ETERNAL God!
Transliteration: lekitsevey hariym yaradetiy haarets vericheyha vaadiy levolam vataal mishachat chayay yehovah elohay

Hebrew: בְּהִתְעַטֵּ֤ף עָלַי֙ נַפְשִׁ֔י אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה זָכָ֑רְתִּי וַתָּב֤וֹא אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ תְּפִלָּתִ֔י אֶל־הֵיכַ֖ל קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
When my life was ebbing away,
I called GOD to mind;
And my prayer came before You,
Into Your holy temple.
Transliteration: vehiteatef alay nafeshiy et-yehovah zakharetiy vatavvo eleykha tefilatiy el-heykhal kׇdeshekha

Hebrew: מְשַׁמְּרִ֖ים הַבְלֵי־שָׁ֑וְא חַסְדָּ֖ם יַעֲזֹֽבוּ׃
Translated:
They who cling to empty folly
Forsake their own welfare,
Transliteration: meshameriym haveley-shave chasedam yaazovu

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י בְּק֤וֹל תּוֹדָה֙ אֶזְבְּחָה־לָּ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָדַ֖רְתִּי אֲשַׁלֵּ֑מָה יְשׁוּעָ֖תָה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I, with loud thanksgiving,
Will sacrifice to You;
What I have vowed I will perform.
Deliverance is GOD’s!
Transliteration: vaaniy vekvol tvodah ezevechah-lakhe asher nadaretiy ashalemah yeshuatah layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה לַדָּ֑ג וַיָּקֵ֥א אֶת־יוֹנָ֖ה אֶל־הַיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> commanded the fish, and it spewed Jonah out upon dry land.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah ladag vayake et-yvonah el-hayavashah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יוֹנָ֖ה שֵׁנִ֥ית לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jonah a second time:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yvonah sheniyt lemor

Hebrew: ק֛וּם לֵ֥ךְ אֶל־נִֽינְוֵ֖ה הָעִ֣יר הַגְּדוֹלָ֑ה וּקְרָ֤א אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֶת־הַקְּרִיאָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י דֹּבֵ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “Go at once to Nineveh, that great city, and proclaim to it what I tell you.”
Transliteration: kum lekhe el-niyneveh haiyr hagedvolah ukera eleyha et-hakeriyah asher anokhiy dover eleykha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם יוֹנָ֗ה וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־נִֽינְוֵ֖ה כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנִֽינְוֵ֗ה הָיְתָ֤ה עִיר־גְּדוֹלָה֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים מַהֲלַ֖ךְ שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
Jonah went at once to Nineveh in accordance with GOD’s command.
Nineveh was an enormously large city a three days’ walk across.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yvonah vayelekhe el-niyneveh khidevar yehovah veniyneveh hayetah iyr-gedvolah lelohiym mahalakhe sheloshet yamiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤חֶל יוֹנָה֙ לָב֣וֹא בָעִ֔יר מַהֲלַ֖ךְ י֣וֹם אֶחָ֑ד וַיִּקְרָא֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר ע֚וֹד אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְנִֽינְוֵ֖ה נֶהְפָּֽכֶת׃
Translated: Jonah started out and made his way into the city the distance of one day’s walk, and proclaimed: “Forty days more, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!”
Transliteration: vayachel yvonah lavvo vaiyr mahalakhe yvom echad vayikera vayomar vod arevaiym yvom veniyneveh nehefakhet

Hebrew: וַֽיַּאֲמִ֛ינוּ אַנְשֵׁ֥י נִֽינְוֵ֖ה בֵּֽאלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקְרְאוּ־צוֹם֙ וַיִּלְבְּשׁ֣וּ שַׂקִּ֔ים מִגְּדוֹלָ֖ם וְעַד־קְטַנָּֽם׃
Translated: The people of Nineveh believed God. They proclaimed a fast, and great and small alike put on sackcloth.
Transliteration: vayaamiynu aneshey niyneveh velohiym vayikereu-tsvom vayileveshu shakiym migedvolam vead-ketanam

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֤ע הַדָּבָר֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ נִֽינְוֵ֔ה וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ מִכִּסְא֔וֹ וַיַּעֲבֵ֥ר אַדַּרְתּ֖וֹ מֵֽעָלָ֑יו וַיְכַ֣ס שַׂ֔ק וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב עַל־הָאֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, took off his robe, put on sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
Transliteration: vayiga hadavar el-melekhe niyneveh vayakׇm mikhisevo vayaaver adaretvo mealayv vayekhas shak vayeshev al-haefer

Hebrew: וַיַּזְעֵ֗ק וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ בְּנִֽינְוֵ֔ה מִטַּ֧עַם הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וּגְדֹלָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר הָאָדָ֨ם וְהַבְּהֵמָ֜ה הַבָּקָ֣ר וְהַצֹּ֗אן אַֽל־יִטְעֲמוּ֙ מְא֔וּמָה אַ֨ל־יִרְע֔וּ וּמַ֖יִם אַל־יִשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated: And he had the word cried through Nineveh: “By decree of the king and his nobles: No human or animal—of flock or herd—shall taste anything! They shall not graze, and they shall not drink water!
Transliteration: vayazeek vayomer veniyneveh mitaam hamelekhe ugedolayv lemor haadam vehavehemah havakar vehatson al-yiteamu meumah al-yireu umayiim al-yishetu

Hebrew: וְיִתְכַּסּ֣וּ שַׂקִּ֗ים הָֽאָדָם֙ וְהַבְּהֵמָ֔ה וְיִקְרְא֥וּ אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּחׇזְקָ֑ה וְיָשֻׁ֗בוּ אִ֚ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָֽרָעָ֔ה וּמִן־הֶחָמָ֖ס אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּכַפֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They shall be covered with sackcloth—human and animal—and shall cry mightily to God. Let everyone turn back from their own evil ways and from the injustice of which they are guilty.
Transliteration: veyitekhasu shakiym haadam vehavehemah veyikereu el-Elohim vechׇzekah veyashuvu iysh midarekhvo haraah umin-hechamas asher vekhafeyhem

Hebrew: מִֽי־יוֹדֵ֣עַ יָשׁ֔וּב וְנִחַ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְשָׁ֛ב מֵחֲר֥וֹן אַפּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א נֹאבֵֽד׃
Translated: Who knows but that God may turn and relent? [God] may turn back from wrathfulness, so that we do not perish.”
Transliteration: miy-yvodea yashuv venicham haElohim veshav mecharvon afvo velo noved

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־מַ֣עֲשֵׂיהֶ֔ם כִּי־שָׁ֖בוּ מִדַּרְכָּ֣ם הָרָעָ֑ה וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים עַל־הָרָעָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר לַעֲשׂוֹת־לָהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: God saw what they did, how they were turning back from their evil ways. And God renounced the punishment that had been planned for them, and did not carry it out.
Transliteration: vayare haElohim et-maasheyhem khiy-shavu midarekham haraah vayinachem haElohim al-haraah asher-diver laashvot-lahem velo ashah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רַע אֶל־יוֹנָ֖ה רָעָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַיִּ֖חַר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: This displeased Jonah greatly, and he was grieved.
Transliteration: vayera el-yvonah raah gedvolah vayichar lvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֨ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֜ה וַיֹּאמַ֗ר אָנָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ הֲלוֹא־זֶ֣ה דְבָרִ֗י עַד־הֱיוֹתִי֙ עַל־אַדְמָתִ֔י עַל־כֵּ֥ן קִדַּ֖מְתִּי לִבְרֹ֣חַ תַּרְשִׁ֑ישָׁה כִּ֣י יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ אֵֽל־חַנּ֣וּן וְרַח֔וּם אֶ֤רֶךְ אַפַּ֙יִם֙ וְרַב־חֶ֔סֶד וְנִחָ֖ם עַל־הָרָעָֽה׃
Translated: He prayed to G<small>OD</small>, saying, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> One! Isn’t this just what I said when I was still in my own country? That is why I fled beforehand to Tarshish. For I know that You are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, abounding in kindness, renouncing punishment.
Transliteration: vayitefalel el-yehovah vayomar anah yehovah halvo-zeh devariy ad-heyvotiy al-adematiy al-khen kidametiy liverocha tareshiyshah khiy yadaetiy khiy atah el-chanun verachum erekhe afayiim verav-chesed venicham al-haraah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה קַח־נָ֥א אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י מִמֶּ֑נִּי כִּ֛י ט֥וֹב מוֹתִ֖י מֵחַיָּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Please, E<small>TERNAL</small> One, take my life, for I would rather die than live.”
Transliteration: veatah yehovah kach-na et-nafeshiy mimeniy khiy tvov mvotiy mechayay {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה הַהֵיטֵ֖ב חָ֥רָה לָֽךְ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> replied, “Are you that deeply grieved?”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah haheytev charah lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א יוֹנָה֙ מִן־הָעִ֔יר וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב מִקֶּ֣דֶם לָעִ֑יר וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ ל֨וֹ שָׁ֜ם סֻכָּ֗ה וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב תַּחְתֶּ֙יהָ֙ בַּצֵּ֔ל עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִרְאֶ֔ה מַה־יִּהְיֶ֖ה בָּעִֽיר׃
Translated: Now Jonah had left the city and found a place east of the city. He made a booth there and sat under it in the shade, until he should see what happened to the city.
Transliteration: vayetse yvonah min-haiyr vayeshev mikedem laiyr vayaash lvo sham sukhah vayeshev tacheteyha vatsel ad asher yireeh mah-yiheyeh vaiyr

Hebrew: וַיְמַ֣ן יְהֹוָֽה־אֱ֠לֹהִ֠ים קִיקָי֞וֹן וַיַּ֣עַל ׀ מֵעַ֣ל לְיוֹנָ֗ה לִֽהְי֥וֹת צֵל֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ לְהַצִּ֥יל ל֖וֹ מֵרָֽעָת֑וֹ וַיִּשְׂמַ֥ח יוֹנָ֛ה עַל־הַקִּֽיקָי֖וֹן שִׂמְחָ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: The E<small>TERNAL</small> God provided a ricinus plant, which grew up over Jonah, to provide shade for his head and save him from discomfort. Jonah was very happy about the plant.
Transliteration: vayeman yehovah-Elohimm kiykayvon vayaal meal leyvonah liheyvot tsel al-roshvo lehatsiyl lvo meraatvo vayishemach yvonah al-hakiykayvon shimechah gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיְמַ֤ן הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ תּוֹלַ֔עַת בַּעֲל֥וֹת הַשַּׁ֖חַר לַֽמׇּחֳרָ֑ת וַתַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הַקִּֽיקָי֖וֹן וַיִּיבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: But the next day at dawn God provided a worm, which attacked the plant so that it withered.
Transliteration: vayeman haElohim tvolaat vaalvot hashachar lamׇchorat vatakhe et-hakiykayvon vayiyvash

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּזְרֹ֣חַ הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ וַיְמַ֨ן אֱלֹהִ֜ים ר֤וּחַ קָדִים֙ חֲרִישִׁ֔ית וַתַּ֥ךְ הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ יוֹנָ֖ה וַיִּתְעַלָּ֑ף וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל אֶת־נַפְשׁוֹ֙ לָמ֔וּת וַיֹּ֕אמֶר ט֥וֹב מוֹתִ֖י מֵחַיָּֽי׃
Translated: And when the sun rose, God provided a sultry east wind; the sun beat down on Jonah’s head, and he became faint. He begged for death, saying, “I would rather die than live.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khizerocha hashemesh vayeman Elohim rucha kadiym chariyshiyt vatakhe hashemesh al-rosh yvonah vayitealaf vayisheal et-nafeshvo lamut vayomer tvov mvotiy mechayay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־יוֹנָ֔ה הַהֵיטֵ֥ב חָרָֽה־לְךָ֖ עַל־הַקִּֽיקָי֑וֹן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הֵיטֵ֥ב חָֽרָה־לִ֖י עַד־מָֽוֶת׃
Translated: Then God said to Jonah, “Are you so deeply grieved about the plant?” “Yes,” he replied, “so deeply that I want to die.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-yvonah haheytev charah-lekha al-hakiykayvon vayomer heytev charah-liy ad-mavet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אַתָּ֥ה חַ֙סְתָּ֙ עַל־הַקִּ֣יקָי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־עָמַ֥לְתָּ בּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֣א גִדַּלְתּ֑וֹ שֶׁבִּן־לַ֥יְלָה הָיָ֖ה וּבִן־לַ֥יְלָה אָבָֽד׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> said: “You cared about the plant, which you did not work for and which you did not grow, which appeared overnight and perished overnight.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah atah chaseta al-hakiykayvon asher lo-amaleta vvo velo gidaletvo shevin-layelah hayah uvin-layelah avad

Hebrew: וַֽאֲנִי֙ לֹ֣א אָח֔וּס עַל־נִינְוֵ֖ה הָעִ֣יר הַגְּדוֹלָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶשׁ־בָּ֡הּ הַרְבֵּה֩ מִֽשְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה רִבּ֜וֹ אָדָ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדַע֙ בֵּין־יְמִינ֣וֹ לִשְׂמֹאל֔וֹ וּבְהֵמָ֖ה רַבָּֽה׃
Translated: And should not I care about Nineveh, that great city, in which there are more than a hundred and twenty thousand persons who do not yet know their right hand from their left, and many animals as well!”
Transliteration: vaaniy lo achus al-niyneveh haiyr hagedvolah asher yesh-vah hareveh misheteym-eshereh rivvo adam asher lo-yada veyn-yemiynvo lishemolvo uvehemah ravah
